p: Zoonoses that are caused by livestock, living with animals, and domestic poultry also occupy a preponderant place in terms of health threat. Rabies, influenza, diarrheal diseases, MERS, Leptospirosis, Leishmaniasis, and Piroplasmosis are the best known examples. Defective prophylactic measures at the humanâ€“animal interface can defuse the contagion ( Day et al., 2012, Zhou, 2012, Cipolla et al., 2015).
